content.description: Shared start with "Dis Waltz".  Start up the wide crack and work directly up to good holds high for the top out. Exit carefully left across various ledges and to crawl over a solid rock ledge to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree.  (Optional sit start on small crimpy ledge for hands and good feet)  [BG 48]
content.location: About ten feet to the left of Hi Life.  Indicated by a stone with the route name abbreviated.

content.description: The crux depends on how you do the problem.Start with hands on the the left low ledge and right side pull that's the same height. Follow right line up.
content.location: The problem sits between Diz Waltz and High Life

content.description: Beta Betty says sit start, work up side pulls, up to good holds higher and a spicy top out (needs more cleaning). Exit carefully left across various ledges to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree.  [BG 46]
content.location: About ten to fifteen feet to the left of V Want Easy.

content.description: Bit of an eliminate as you try to avoid using the crack in the right for hands.  Start with left hand on crimpy side pull and right on good sidepull dish, match hands right and go up.  See photo for start.  After the top out go to the right around a second large shelf, head uphill to find the path and walk off to the left.  [BG 43]
content.location: Directly right of the double roofs.

content.description: Climb the face directly up trying to avoid the dihedral.  Trying to top out gracefully might be the crux.  [BG 45]
content.location: Directly left of Dirty South Dihedral.

content.description: Crux is getting over your fear of heights, sloper pinch, body positioning, and the second to last hold is a little hard to find.
content.location: Start on main life but work right along the seam with decent crimps. Tree is off. No touchy.

content.description: Work up juggy pocketed holds to a layback flake/crack (or two).  Exit carefully up and left to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree.  [BG 47]
content.location: Left of Cat or Pillar.  See photo for line.

content.description: Same start as Hi Life.  Instead of going left take the direct line up on better holds.  There is a significant jug up high right that makes the topout have less of a pucker factor (Safety Steve says scout the topout holds first).  Crawl or carefully traverse right on a good ledge and around the big tree root to the descent. [BG 49]
content.location: Far right side of Dystopia.  There is a notable block protruding from the ground.  Start on the wall at the right edge of the block.  Indicated by a stone with the route name abbreviated.

content.description: Standing start on sharp holds in the middle pockets/ledge and go up to sharp holds in the crack/gap.  Exit carefully up and left to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree.  (there is a possible sit start here that would make it harder)  [BG 44]
content.location: Arete to the left of Dirty South Dihedral.

content.description: Climb up the crack.  It's not wack like sometimes purported (T. Biggums approves).  Exit carefully up and left to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree. [BG 43]
content.location: Right of the double roofs of the Double D routes.

content.description: Stand start on two side pulls (see pictured start holds). Use pockets at head level then move right to crimpy block with a solid thumb catch.  Move left to lie back on flake/crack, find decent smeared feet and move high left to good side pulls, find more good smeared feet then step high into a medium dish.  Decent holds on the topout.  When you get to the top you may think to yourself: "Dog, it's real up [in] here".  Indeed it is.  Crawl or carefully traverse right on a good ledge and around the big tree root to the descent.  (rating might be easier if the climber is taller)  [BG 49]
content.location: Far right side of Dystopia.  There is a notable block protruding from the ground.  Start on the wall at the right edge of the block.  Indicated by a stone with the route name abbreviated.

content.description: Work up the right side of the fat arete on large pocketed holds.  Exit carefully up and left to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree. [BG 47]
content.location: Left of Ode to Bozo before the wall turns a corner.  See photo for line.

content.description: Go up and right over the roofs.  See photo for start.  Try to avoid the block top right on the second roof as it's loose but we couldn't get it to come off.  After the top out go to the right around a second large shelf, head uphill to find the path and walk off to the left. [BG 42]
content.location: Toward the left side of the Dystopia area with double distinct roofs stacked.

content.description: Go up and left over the roofs.  See photo for start.  After the top out go to the right around a second large shelf, head uphill to find the path and walk off to the left.  [BG 42]
content.location: Toward the left side of the Dystopia area with double distinct roofs stacked.

content.description: Shared start with "V Want Easy" to produce a sophisticated yet gritty experience.  Start up the wide crack then work the undercling/layback flake right with decent smeared feet to good holds high for the top out. Exit carefully left across various ledges and to crawl over a solid rock ledge to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree.  (Optional sit start on small crimpy ledge for hands and good feet)  [BG 48]
content.location: About ten feet to the left of Hi Life.  Indicated by a stone with the route name abbreviated.

content.description: Send up the dihedral and top out using the large solid block top left.  Do it.... do it.  [BG 45]

Work up the fun juggy crack/flake.  Exit carefully left across various ledges to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree. [BG 46]
content.location: Left of Todd $haw.  See photo for line and look for big, wide flake/crack feature.

content.description: Start with hands on the ledge in the middle and up to a good sidepull.  Stand up with good feet and top out on decent holds at the lip.  Exit carefully up and left to gain the sloping dirt path for the walkoff (approx 40-50 yards) marked by a tree with a yellow rope and good rocky walkoff ledges behind the tree. [BG 45]
content.location: Wall to the right of Dirty South Dihedral.

content.description: Winter and early spring sun but otherwise shaded the rest of the year. Good landing areas for bouldering and easily approached from the ridge trail.  Good for top outs as there are walkoffs both to the left (longer) and right depending on route location.
